channel.title: Pages on Syniti Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Syniti Documentation

item.title: Disposition
item.description: Disposition Use this page to: Register External Process Validations Register Stored Procedure Validations Register View Validations Run Interface Events Sequentially To access this page, select Configuration > Disposition in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new dispositions or to edit delivered dispositions; the Automate code would need to be updated for the disposition to properly work.

item.title: Event Types
item.description: Event Types Use this page to: Register Interface Events About Automate Events Register Stored Procedure Events Register WebApp Events Register Workflow Events Copy Files from One Folder to Another Set Up a Looping Process To access this page, select Configuration > Event Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new event types or to edit the delivered event types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the event type to properly work.

item.title: File Format Types
item.description: File Format Types Use this page to Add Logical Paths. To access this page, select IO Config > File Modification Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new file modification types or to edit the delivered file modification types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the file modification type to properly work.

item.title: File Modification Types
item.description: File Modification Types Use this page to Add Logical Paths. To access this page, select IO Config > File Format Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new file modification types or to edit the delivered file modification types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the file modification type to properly work.

item.title: File Operations H
item.description: File Operations H File Operations V Use this page to: Add File Operations Set up a Looping Process To access this page, select IO Config > File Operations in the Navigation pane. File Operations V File Operations H Field Description Operation Displays the name of the operation to be performed. Logical Path In Displays the registered data source from which files are transferred. Logical Path In URI For FTP sites, displays the entire path of the registered data source, including log in credentials (user ID and password).

item.title: History
item.description: History Use this page to View History of an Interface. To access this page, select History in the Navigation pane.

item.title: History (Chart)
item.description: History (Chart) Use this page to View History of an Interface. To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the Chart icon to open for the desired interface. Field Description Daily Duration Displays how long the interface took to complete each day. Historical Duration Displays the average processing time for the interface to complete.

item.title: History (Detail) V
item.description: History (Detail) H History (Detail) V Use this page to View History of an Interface. To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. History (Detail) V History (Detail) H

item.title: History Failed (Detail) H
item.description: History Failed (Detail) H Use this page to View History of an Interface . To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the Failed icon for the desired interface. History Failed (Detail) V History Failed (Detail) V History (Detail) H

item.title: Interface Event (Validations) H
item.description: Interface Event (Validations) H Interface Event (Validations) V Use this page to: Register Interface Validations Run Interface Events Sequentially Register External Process Validations To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click the Validations icon for the desired event. Interface Event (Validations) V Interface Event (Validations) H

item.title: Interface Events H
item.description: Interface Events H Interface Events V Use this page to: Register Interface Events Register Stored Procedure Events Register WebApp Events Register Workflow Events Copy Files from One Folder to Another Set Up a Looping Process To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Interface Events V Interface Events H Field Description Event ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the event.

item.title: Interface History H
item.description: Interface History H Interface History V Use this page to View History of an Interface. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Field Description TIME STARTED Displays the time the interface started running. TIME COMPLETED Displays the time the interface finished running. MESSAGE Displays a message to indicate if the interface completed, failed or if there is an error.

item.title: Interface Validations H
item.description: Interface Validations H Interface Validations V Use this page to Register Interface Validations. To access this page: Select Interface in the Navigation pane. Click the Validations icon for the desired interface. Interface Validations V Interface Validations H

item.title: Interfaces H
item.description: Interfaces H Interfaces V Use this page to: Create an Interface Schedule Interfaces Activate Interfaces, Events and Validations Test Interfaces Schedule Interfaces View History of an Interface To access this page, select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Interfaces V Interfaces H This page contains the following tabs: General tab Contact Info tab Schedule Info tab Logging tab General tab Use this tab to Create an Interface.

item.title: Log H
item.description: Log H Log V Use this page to View Logs for an Interface. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Click the Important icon to view the Log page filtered by tasks with a level set at Reporting by Importance Level or above. This icon is only enabled of there are tasks written to the log for the interface according to the level set in the Reporting by Importance Level field on the Parameters page.

item.title: Logging Modules
item.description: Logging Modules Use this page to Add Logging Modules. To access this page: Select Configuration > Parameters in the Navigation pane. Click the Modules icon.

item.title: Logging Severities H
item.description: Logging Severities H Logging Severities V Use this page to Configure Logging Severities. To access this page, select Configuration > Logging > Severities in the Navigation pane. Logging Severities V Logging Severities H Field Description Priority Displays a number to indicate the logging severity. Name Displays the name of the logging severity. Description Displays a description of what the logging severity indicates and examples of when it might apply. Image Info

item.title: Logical Path (Instance) H
item.description: Logical Path (Instance) H Logical Path (Instance) V Use this page to Add Logical Paths. To access this page: Select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Click the Instances icon for the desired logical path. Logical Path (Instance) V Logical Path (Instance) H Field Description Transport Type Displays the type of file transport. Options are: Local – Local File System, which means the files are in folders to which the DSP can read/write.

item.title: Logical Path Instance (Browse)
item.description: Logical Path Instance (Browse) Use this page to Browse FTP Site or Path. To access this page: Select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Click the Instances icon for the desired logical path. Click the Browse icon for the desired instance.

item.title: Logical Paths H
item.description: Logical Paths H Logical Paths V Use this page to Add Logical Paths. To access this page, select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Logical Paths V Logical Paths H

item.title: Monitor (Events) H
item.description: Monitor (Events) H Monitor (Events) V Use this page to Monitor Interfaces & Events. To access this page: Select Monitor in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Or Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane to monitor a single interface. Click Vertical View for the desired interface. Click the Monitor icon. Click the Events icon for the desired interface.

item.title: Monitor H
item.description: Monitor H Monitor V Use this page to Monitor Interfaces & Events. To access this page, select Monitor in the Navigation pane. Monitor V Monitor H

item.title: Parameters
item.description: Parameters Use this page to Configure Automate Parameters. To access this page, select Configuration > Parameters in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is recommended for only developers or system administrators to edit Automate parameters. Field Description Application Displays the name of the application: InterfaceServer. NOTE: Automate is formerly known as InterfaceServer. Application Version Displays the version number of the application. Database Version Displays the database version that the application is using.

item.title: Purpose
item.description: Purpose Use this page to: Register External Process Validations Register Stored Procedure Validations Register View Validations To access this page, select Configuration > Purpose in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new purposes or to edit the delivered purposes; the Automate code would need to be updated for the purpose to properly work.

item.title: Reports
item.description: Reports Use this page to access installed Automate reports. To access this page, select Reports from the Navigation pane. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the priority in which the Automate reports display. REPORT Displays the report available in Automate. Click to view the report.

item.title: Role (Instance)
item.description: Role (Instance) Use this page to Assign Users to Roles. To access this page: Select Configuration > Roles in the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for the desired role.

item.title: Roles
item.description: Roles Use this page to Add Roles. To access this page, select Configuration > Roles in the Navigation pane.

item.title: Stored Procedure
item.description: Stored Procedure Use this page to Register Stored Procedure Events. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of StoredProcedure. Field Description Field Displays the field from the stored procedure view that is passed to the event.

item.title: Tasks
item.description: Tasks Use this page to View History of an Interface. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Click the Tasks icon for the desired interface run. Field Description TASK Displays the Task icon. NAME Displays the descriptive name of the tasks that has run for an interface.

item.title: Transport Types H
item.description: Transport Types H Transport Types V Use this page to Add Logical Paths. To access this page, select IO Config > Transport Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new transport types or to edit the delivered transport types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the transport type type to properly work. Transport Types V Transport Types H This page contains the following tabs:

item.title: UOM
item.description: UOM This page is used to: Set Retry Parameters Run Interface Events Sequentially Schedule Interfaces To access this page, select Configuration > UOM in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new UOMs or to edit the delivered UOMs; the Automate code would need to be updated for the UOM to properly work.

item.title: WebApp Event
item.description: WebApp Event Use this page to Register WebApp Events. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of WebApp. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the WebApp view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: Workflow
item.description: Workflow Use this page to Register Workflow Events. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the workflow view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: Workflow (Email)
item.description: Workflow (Email) Use this page to Register Workflow Events. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Fields icon. Field Description Interface ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the interface. Event ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the event.

item.title: Workflow Links
item.description: Workflow Links Use this page to Register Workflow Events. To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Links icon. NOTE: The Links icon is only enabled if the Link to Page ID field is populated. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the order in which the link appears in the workflow (if there are multiple links).
